snippet: Sliding sports, like bobsled or luge or skeleton, are often decided by thousandths of a second, making it difficult for fans to watch and to know when to cheer.
abstract: Olympic sliding sports, like bobsled or luge or skeleton, are often decided by thousandths of a second, making it difficult for fans to watch and to know when to cheer; even the athletes, who watch these sports all the time, say they struggle to figure out what is going on in the middle of someone else’s trip down the labyrinthine track.
lead_paragraph: Sliding sports, like bobsled or luge or skeleton, are often decided by thousandths of a second, making it difficult for fans to watch and to know when to cheer.
